title: Melbourne medical centre sold to horse racing's Ken Biddick for $25m
text:
Well-known local investor and horse racing identity Ken Biddick has paid around $25 million to buy a medical centre in Melbourne's outer northern suburbs in one of the largest deals in the asset class this year.

The sale of the Thompsons Road Clinic at 2 Woodbine Road was struck on a low passing yield of just over 5 per cent.

Selling agents CBRE said it was the largest public medical offering in Victoria in more than four years, in what has become a sought-after passive income asset by private investors.

The medical centre stands on a larger corner site.

The 1400-square-metre medical centre on a large corner site was offered for sale by local GP Dr Leon Shapero. Dr Shapero developed the two-level complex in 1987 and still occupies a part of it.

It sold with an attractive 15-year triple-net lease expiring in 2049 and now brings in $1.3 million in annual rent from tenants including GPs, a pharmacy, radiologist and other specialists.
description: The 1400-square metre medical centre was offered for sale by local GP Dr Leon Shapero, who developed the two-level complex in 1987.
